awd_titl_txt: New Approaches to Modelling of Transport Phenomena in PackedTubes
awd_abstract_narration: The purpose of this research is to develop a new method to deal                 with packed-tube reactors where the tube to particle diameter                   ratio is small.  Such reactors are widely used in industrial                    applications for difficult to control exothermic  reaction.                                                                                                     The PI is developing a novel approach using the microscopic                     conservation equations to model the interaction of the transport                processes with the rates of reaction.  The technique involves                   formal solution of the overall equation combined with                           experimental work to provide the needed parameters.  In the final               analysis, a numerical technique emerges which can be adjusted for               accuracy by changing grid sizes.  Coarse grids allow fast                       simulations even for large packed beds - fine grids allow                       particulate resolution where this is desired.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems

pgm_ele.pgm_ele_name: Proc Sys, Reac Eng & Mol Therm
